newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: China Fujian oil refinery maintenance in April '97.
newsitem.headline: China Fujian oil refinery maintenance in April '97.

text.p: China's southeastern Fujian oil refinery plans to hike its crude throughput by 1.5 million tonnes per year following a scheduled maintenance shutdown in April 1997, a company source said on Tuesday.
"We will be shutting the 2.5 million tonnes per year (50,000 barrels per day) refinery for around a month starting in early April for both maintenance and upgrading," the source told Reuters.
"We planned to debottleneck the refinery and raise its runs to 4 million tonnes per year (80,000 bpd)," he said.
The source said that with the increased crude throughput, the additional oil products will be sold in the domestic market.
The company aims to further expand its refining capacity by almost three times to 12 million tonnes per year (240,000 bpd) by the year 2000, he said. This comes under China's ninth five-year plan.
"The additional products produced then will be for the export market," the source said.
